models.name: January
models.description: Janus is the Roman god of gates and doorways, depicted with two faces looking in opposite directions. His festival month is January.

models.name: February
models.description: Februa is the Roman festival of purification, held on February fifteenth. It is possibly of Sabine origin.

models.name: March
models.description: March was the original beginning of the year, and the time for the resumption of war.

models.name: April
models.description: Aphrodite is the Greek goddess of love and beauty. She is identified with the Roman goddess Venus.

models.name: May
models.description: Maia (meaning 'the great one') is the Italic goddess of spring, the daughter of Faunus, and wife of Vulcan.

models.name: June
models.description: Juno is the principle goddess of the Roman Pantheon. She is the goddess of marriage and the well-being of women. She is the wife and sister of Jupiter. She is identified with the Greek goddess Hera.

models.name: July
models.description: Julius Caesar reformed the Roman calendar (hence the Julian calendar) in 46 BC. In the process, he renamed this month after himself.

models.name: August
models.description: Augustus Caesar clarified and completed the calendar reform of Julius Caesar. In the process, he also renamed this month after himself.
